page.title: 03ENVIRONMENT-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: Crops are grown intensively as we have some of the best land in the country. Farmers are now getting very keen on planting trees and hedges again, and some big projects are planned for our area. As a result, we now have a lot of pheasants, partridges, hares and even foxes. We already have a great variety of sea birds, some of which are winter or summer visitors like the sedge warbler and the ringed plover. Our wild flowers are mainly confined to the roadsides, but many tulip fields have poppies and tall daisies growing amongst them in the summer.
